Second assignment documentation!

This is the documentation of the erl2 package

GoToPoint Module

This node drives the robot to the desired position received

Subscriber:

/odom

Publisher:

/cmd_vel

ActionServer:

go_to_point_action: action server to receive the coordinates of the place to reach

It’s performed as the node that allows the robot to move: it contains all the functions to set the velocity and the orientation of the robot basing on the target it has to reach via the ActionGoal that was sent from the gotoWaypoint node. In order to do this, when a new target is generated the robot aligns its orientation respect to the target position one, then moves to the target. Once the target is reached, the node sets the target action as succeeded, then waits until a new target position is sent.

scripts.go_to_point.ang_coef = 2

coefficient to manage the angular velocity of the robot during the motion

Type

int

scripts.go_to_point.change_state(state)[source]

Function to change the state of th FSM in the go_to_point function

Parameters

state (int) – new state of the FSM

scripts.go_to_point.clbk_odom(msg)[source]

Callback to get the odometry of the robot

Parameters

msg (Odom) – odometry of the robot with its x, y, z coordinates and orientation

scripts.go_to_point.done()[source]

Function to stop the robot by setting its linear and angular velocity to zero

scripts.go_to_point.fix_final_yaw(des_yaw)[source]

Function to fix the orientation of the robot on the basis of the desired orientation

Parameters

des_yaw (float) – desired yaw angle

scripts.go_to_point.fix_yaw(des_pos)[source]

Function to direct the robot towards the target rotation

Parameters

des_pos (float) – desired position to reach

scripts.go_to_point.go_straight_ahead(des_pos)[source]

Function to move the robot straight ahead from its actual position to a certain destination

Parameters

des_pos (Pose) – object containing the x and y coordinates of the position to reach

scripts.go_to_point.go_to_point(goal)[source]

Function that gets the goal position to reach and, basing on that, calls the functions to perform the motion of the robot. It checks if the goal has’t been cancelled; in this case it sets the state_ variable to 3 in order to terminate the process to move to reach a certain position

Parameters

msg (MoveGoal) – action goal to get the coordinates of the position to reach

scripts.go_to_point.lin_coef = 1.7

coefficient to manage the linear velocity of the robot during the motion

Type

int

scripts.go_to_point.main()[source]

Main function that performs the initialization of the node itself and initializes all the services and subscribers.

scripts.go_to_point.normalize_angle(angle)[source]

Function to normalize the angle of the rotation that the robot must perform

Parameters

angle (float) – angle of the rotation to perform

OntologyInterface Module

This node allows to modify the ontology and perform queries

Services:
/check_consistency service to ask for complete and consistent hypothesis in the ontology and

to use them as possible solutions to the cluedo game

/update_request service to update the ontology by adding the hints to the ontology and by performing the “REASON” command

It’s the node that allows to initialize the ontology, add items and asking queries; it receives the hints from the /oracle_hint service, then add them in a list. It also updates the ontology when a request is received: it loads all the new hints in the ontology and performs the REASON operation; then it searches for complete and consistent hypotheses when /check_consistency is called, removes the inconsistent ones from the ontology and compares the complete and consistent ones with the solution ID provided by the /oracle_solution service. If the solution is correct it also queries the person, the place and the weapon of the solution and prints them, then sends the ResetRequest with the “finish” parameter equal to True; otherwise it removes the incorrect IDs and returns the ResetRequest with the “finish” parameter equal to False

scripts.ontology_interface.ID = []

Initialize ID list

Type

list

scripts.ontology_interface.ask_solution = None

Initialize /oracle_solution service client

scripts.ontology_interface.consistency_service = None

Initialize /consistency_request service server

scripts.ontology_interface.init_scene()[source]

Function to initialize the scene, it adds all the information about the scene to the armor ontology by loading all the people, places and weapons. When a new element is loaded in the ontology it must be disjointed respect to the others of the same class, in order to notify the ontology that they are different. Finally it preforms ‘REASON’ command to update the ontology.

scripts.ontology_interface.key = []

Initialize key list (each element is referred to the corresponding element in the ID list)

Type

list

scripts.ontology_interface.main()[source]

Main function of the ontology_interface node; it declares the node itself, initializes all the services and calls the init_scene function to initialize the ontology

scripts.ontology_interface.people_ontology = ['missScarlett', 'colonelMustard', 'mrsWhite', 'mrGreen', 'mrsPeacock', 'profPlum']

Define all the people of the scene

Type

list[str]

scripts.ontology_interface.places_ontology = ['conservatory', 'lounge', 'kitchen', 'library', 'hall', 'study', 'bathroom', 'diningRoom', 'billiardRoom']

Define all the places of the scene

Type

list[str]

scripts.ontology_interface.receive_hint(hint)[source]

Callback to get the hints from the simulation node; each element of the hint is appended in a list

Parameters

hint (Hint) – is the hint received from the simulation node

scripts.ontology_interface.reset_client = None

Initialize /reset_planning service client

scripts.ontology_interface.try_solution(msg)[source]

Callback to find complete and consistent hypothesis when the /check_consistency service is called, it also removes inconsistent IDs. It also uses the complete and consistent hypothesis as possible solutions, by comparing their IDs with the solution ID provided by the /oracle_solution service; in case one of them corresponds to the solution ID, it queries the place, the person and the weapon of the solution and sets the ResetRequest to True, otherwise the ID is removed by the ontology and the ResetRequest is set to False

Parameters

msg (ConsistencyRequest) – not utilized

Returns

not utilized

Return type

res(ConsistencyResponse)

scripts.ontology_interface.update_ontology(msg)[source]

Callback to update the ontology when the /update_request is called; it adds all the hypothesis in the ontology, then updates it by using the REASON command.

Parameters

msg (UpdateRequest) – not utilized

Returns

not utilized

Return type

res(UpdateResponse)

scripts.ontology_interface.update_service = None

Initialize /update_request service server

scripts.ontology_interface.value = []

Initialize value list (each element is referred to the corresponding element in the ID list)

Type

list

scripts.ontology_interface.weapons_ontology = ['candlestick', 'dagger', 'leadPipe', 'revolver', 'rope', 'spanner']

Define all the weapons of the scene

Type

list[str]

ResetPlanner Module

This node allows to modify the ontology and perform queries

Services:
/check_consistency service to ask for complete and consistent hypothesis in the ontology and

to use them as possible solutions to the cluedo game

/update_request service to update the ontology by adding the hints to the ontology and by performing the “REASON” command

It’s the node that allows to initialize the ontology, add items and asking queries; it receives the hints from the /oracle_hint service, then add them in a list. It also updates the ontology when a request is received: it loads all the new hints in the ontology and performs the REASON operation; then it searches for complete and consistent hypotheses when /check_consistency is called, removes the inconsistent ones from the ontology and compares the complete and consistent ones with the solution ID provided by the /oracle_solution service. If the solution is correct it also queries the person, the place and the weapon of the solution and prints them, then sends the ResetRequest with the “finish” parameter equal to True; otherwise it removes the incorrect IDs and returns the ResetRequest with the “finish” parameter equal to False

MyArmor Class

Service:

/armor_interface_srv service to send the messages to ARMOR

This class implements the ARMOR operations to use during the Cluedo game.

This class is created to use in a more comfortable way the ARMOR commands, providing some methods that already create and sends the correct messages to the armor_interface_srv service.

class scripts.classes.myArmor.MyArmor[source]

Simple class to use in a more comfortable way the ARMOR commands, providing some methods that already create and send the correct messages to the armor_interface_srv service.

add_hypothesis(ID, arg)[source]

Add the hypothesis to the ontology

Args: type(string): the type of element to add (what, where or who)

ID(string): the ID of the hypothesis arg(string): the name of the place/weapon/person to add to the ontology

Returns:

res(ArmorDirectiveRes): the response received from ARMOR

add_item(type)[source]

Add an element to the ontology

Args:

name(string): the name of the element type(string): the type of the element (PERSON/PLACE/WEAPON)

Returns:

res(ArmorDirectiveRes): the response received from ARMOR

ask_complete()[source]

Asks to the ontology for completed hypothesis

Returns:

res(ArmorDirectiveRes): the response received from ARMOR

ask_inconsistent()[source]

Asks to the ontology for inconsistent hypothesis

Returns:

res(ArmorDirectiveRes): the response received from ARMOR

ask_item(ID)[source]

Ask the name of a certain element of a hypothesis

Args:

type(string): the type of the element (what, where or who) ID(string): the ID of the hypothesis

Returns:

res(ArmorDirectiveRes): the response received from ARMOR

disjoint(ind2)[source]

Disjoint two elements to notify the otology that they are different

Args:

ind1(string): the name of the first element ind1(string): the name of the second element

Returns:

res(ArmorDirectiveRes): the response received from ARMOR

Load the ontology from file

Args:

path(string): the path in which there’s the file with the ontology to load

Returns:

response(ArmorDirectiveRes): the response received from ARMOR

Perform reason to update the ontology

Returns:

res(ArmorDirectiveRes): the response received from ARMOR

remove()[source]

Remove a hypothesis from the ontology

Args:

name(string): the name of the hypothesis to remove

Returns:

res(ArmorDirectiveRes): the response received from ARMOR

save()[source]

Save the current ontology

Returns:

res(ArmorDirectiveReq): the response received from ARMOR

Defines the armor_interface_srv service to send the messages to ARMOR

Planner Class

Service:

rosplan_knowledge_base/update service to update the knowledge base

rosplan_plan_dispatcher/dispatch_plan service to dispatch the plan

rosplan_knowledge_base/clear service to clear the plan

rosplan_parsing_interface/parse_plan service to parse the plan

rosplan_problem_interface/problem_generation_server service to generate the problem

rosplan_planner_interface/planning_server service to generate the plan

This class implements the operations to interact with the ROSPlan knowledge base.

This class is created to update in a more comfortable way the ROSPlan knowledge base, providing some methods that create and send the correct messages to the ROSPlan services.

class scripts.classes.planner.Planner[source]

Simple class to update in a more comfortable way the ROSPlan knowledge base

add_attribute(key, value, is_negative=False)[source]

Function to add a new attribute in the knowledge base

Parameters

  • attribute_name (string) – the name of the attribute

  • key (string[]) – the instance type which is referred to

  • value (string[]) – the list with the names of the corresponding instances

  • is_negative (bool) – to determine if is a negative condition or not (default to False)

Returns

the response received from rosplan_knowledge_base/update service

Return type

res(KnowledgeUpdateServiceResponse)

Movearm

Node to perform the movearm action of the PDDL domain.

description: This node implements the ROSPlan MovearmActionInterface: the corresponding behaviour for the movearm action in the PDDl file

Version

1.0

Author

Alessio Roda

Date

October 2022

Defines

_USE_MATH_DEFINES

Functions

int main(int argc, char **argv)

Main function of the node.

int main(argc, argv)

description: The main function, initializes the client for the /check_state_validity and /get_planning_scene services, declares the MovearmActionInterface and runs it

Parameters

  • argc – the number of argument passed as parameters

  • argv – the vector of string containing each argument

Returns

0 when the program ends

Variables

Init

Node to move the arm in the correct initial position.

description: This node moves the robotic arm to the initial_pose defined with the moveit setup assistant

Version

1.0

Author

Alessio Roda

Date

October 2022

Functions

int main(int argc, char **argv)

Main function of the node.

int main(argc, argv)

description: The main function, initializes the node, loads the arm model of the robot described with the moveit_setup_assistant, gets the “arm” move group to move the robotic arm and moves it in the initial_pose position

Parameters

  • argc – the number of argument passed as parameters

  • argv – the vector of string containing each argument

Returns

0 when the program ends
